intro: Thymus albanus subvar. schefferi, commonly known as the Albanian thyme, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the Balkan Peninsula. It features compact, creeping growth with small, gray-green leaves that are aromatic and covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of tiny, pinkish-white flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and alpine settings. Its aromatic foliage and ornamental value make it a popular choice for both horticultural and medicinal uses.
